themes: Support for marginalized and under-resourced artists
key_phrases: become more accessible, equitable, and transparent
many creatives are excluded simply because the process is too complex or time-consuming
prioritized for BIPOC, LGBTQ+, disabled, and economically disadvantaged artists
not everything needs to be project-based
barriers_identified: exclusion of independent artists, grassroots organizations, and historically marginalized communities
limited support for operational and capacity-building needs
solutions_proposed: streamlined, mobile-friendly applications with video/audio submission options
prioritizing funding for BIPOC, LGBTQ+, disabled, and economically disadvantaged artists and collectives
offering microgrants and multi-year operational funding
clarifying decision-making processes and publishing metrics and feedback
hosting workshops, one-on-one support sessions, and community check-ins year-round
using public funding as a catalyst for long-term infrastructure and sustainable income through partnerships, residencies, or cooperative models
